intro: Calathea leuconeura, commonly known as the White Vein Calathea, is a tropical plant native to South America. It is characterized by its striking, dark green leaves with distinctive white veins that create a striking contrast. The plant belongs to the Marantaceae family and is prized for its ornamental value in indoor gardening. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires consistent moisture and high humidity to flourish. Its foliage changes color subtly with the seasons, adding an element of dynamic beauty to its appearance.
